org.smtlib

Class SMT

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.smtlib.SMT

  • public class SMT
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the main class for the SMT-LIB tool. The tool is invoked as a command-line tool by running main within org.smtlib.SMT. The tool can also be invoked programmatically by calling exec() in a new instance of the SMT class, created with the default constructor. Separate instances of SMT objects can be run independently and in parallel. They are thread-safe (though they all may write to the same standard and error output streams).

    To extend this tool, e.g. to use it with other factory objects for a different implementation, or to add configuration options:

    • Create subclasses of SMT, SMT.Configuration
    • The SMT' should set a new object of type SMT.Configuration' in its constructor
    • SMT' can override parseCommandLine, help, usage
    • Create a new main method; the new main should also instantiate the derived SMT and call exec on it
    • SMT.Configuration' can have new options added; it can also instantiate different object factories
    • SMT.COnfiguration' can also instantiate a derived Utils or Log object
    • FIXME - more; parseCommandLine, help, usage are not easy to extend; what about replacing the SymbolTable or SolverProcess; should have interfaces for Log, Utils?

      • exec

        public int exec(java.lang.String[] args)
        The method that does all the execution for the main method, here made a non-static method, so that multiple SMT operations can be proceeding independently.
        Parameters:
        args - the command-line arguments
        Returns:
        the exit code to return to the command-line: FIXME - document exit codes

        Executes, presuming all options (e.g. from the command-line) are set in the configuration object

      • startSolver

        public ISolver startSolver(SMT.Configuration smtConfig,
                  java.lang.String solvername,
                  java.lang.String executableIn)
        Starts the solver with the given name and executable, preset according to the given configuration. If executable is null, then an executable path is looked for in the org.smtlib.SMT_EXE_solvername property or the SMT_EXE_solvername environment variable.
        Parameters:
        smtConfig - the configuration object to use for solver settings
        solvername - the name of the solver to use
        executable - the executable path
        Returns:
        the ISolver object, or null if errors happened
